attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "type of billings in bolt", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User
Real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows that keep product owners and consumers moving in sync.
What it is
: Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for organizations that manage fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It merges real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting into a single web experience.
Who it’s for
:
Product Owners: orchestrate programs, configure roles, and align KPIs.
Portal Operators: run daily operations—devices, trips, notifications, incidents, yard logistics.
Pu", "[2] Title: Live Tracking & Remote Operations | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/live-tracking-and-remote-operations
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Live Tracking & Remote Operations
hashtag
Live Tracking & Remote Operations
The tracking interface utilizes
Leaflet
to provide a high-performance, real-time visualization of your fleet.
Visual Overlays:
Toggle between standard road maps, high-resolution satellite imagery, and live traffic data.
Marker Logic:
Vehicle icons change color dynamically based on state:
Green:
Ignition On / Moving.
Yellow:
Idle (Ignition On but stationary).
Red:
Ignition Off.
Grey:
Inactive (No data received for a set period).
hashtag
Vehicle Marker Legend & Status Logic
This page def", "[3] Title: Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors
Excerpt: copy
Copy

Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors

Parent Org is charged.
Purchase with 0 local balance

The transaction is blocked instantly.
No charge; user must recharge.

The system verifies the wallet type before", "[4] Title: UI/UX Specifications & Design System | Documentation | Roadcast Docs

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Bolt's billing system supports different configurations primarily categorized as centralized and decentralized billing modes. These modes affect how funds are managed and transactions are processed within the platform.

## Key Details
- In centralized billing, if a local balance is zero, the system automatically charges the Parent Wallet, allowing the purchase to succeed.
- In decentralized billing, a zero local balance causes the transaction to fail immediately, requiring the user to recharge before proceeding.
- The system also verifies wallet types during add-on activations to ensure proper billing behavior [3].

## References
[3] Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors"}

[[ ## user_question ## ]]

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
Bolt's billing system supports different configurations primarily categorized as centralized and decentralized billing modes. These modes affect how funds are managed and transactions are processed within the platform.

## Key Details
- In centralized billing, if a local balance is zero, the system automatically charges the Parent Wallet, allowing the purchase to succeed.
- In decentralized billing, a zero local balance causes the transaction to fail immediately, requiring the user to recharge before proceeding.
- The system also verifies wallet types during add-on activations to ensure proper billing behavior [3].

## References
[3] Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors"]

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"signature": "GitBookAnswerSignature(system_prompt, user_question, snippets, format_instructions -> answer_markdown
    instructions='Formats GitBook search snippets into a markdown answer with references.'
    system_prompt = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Agent system prompt describing persona and guardrails', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'System Prompt:'})
    user_question = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'End-user query to answer', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'User Question:'})
    snippets = Field(annotation=List[str] required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Snippets:'})
    format_instructions = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Format Instructions:'})
    answer_markdown = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list', '__dspy_field_type': 'output', 'prefix': 'Answer Markdown:'})
)", "completion": "[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
Bolt's billing system supports different configurations primarily categorized as centralized and decentralized billing modes. These modes affect how funds are managed and transactions are processed within the platform.

## Key Details
- In centralized billing, if a local balance is zero, the system automatically charges the Parent Wallet, allowing the purchase to succeed.
- In decentralized billing, a zero local balance causes the transaction to fail immediately, requiring the user to recharge before proceeding.
- The system also verifies wallet types during add-on activations to ensure proper billing behavior [3].

## References
[3] Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors"}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Bolt's billing system supports different configurations primarily categorized as centralized and decentralized billing modes. These modes affect how funds are managed and transactions are processed within the platform.

## Key Details
- In centralized billing, if a local balance is zero, the system automatically charges the Parent Wallet, allowing the purchase to succeed.
- In decentralized billing, a zero local balance causes the transaction to fail immediately, requiring the user to recharge before proceeding.
- The system also verifies wallet types during add-on activations to ensure proper billing behavior [3].

## References
[3] Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors"}
